alert.note: Alert for Livingston (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 03 at 6:06PM EDT until August 03 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: .Heavy rain from thunderstorms will continue to affect the area over the next hour or two. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Michigan, including the following county, Livingston. * WHEN...Until 915 PM EDT. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 605 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen so far. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hartland, Howell, Brighton, Fowlerville, Pinckney, Hamburg, Cohoctah, Oak Grove, Gregory, Whitmore Lake, Plainfield, Unadilla, Chilson, Deerfield Township, Lakeland, Hell, Pinckney State Recreation Area, Parkers Corners, Tyrone Township and Island Lake State Recreation Area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
